Class Channel3 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----Channel3
public class Channel3
extends Object
Simulates Channel3, which does so much stuff you won't believe it. It does Input Spooling, Output Spooling, Loading, handles GD and PD instructions, and contributes to the downfall of the Furbies.

Version:
11.30.1998, 12.06.1998
Author:
Ethan Georgi & Ken Schulz

Constructor.

addToCh3Q(PCB)
Add the PCB to the Channel3 queue, for GD or PD commands.

Input Spooling Checks inputFullBuffer for data cards Creates a new PCB if $JOB is called Uses inSpoolPCB to build a PCB

The interrupt routine.

Loading.
outputSpooling()
Handles the final termination of a process.
setBusy()
Assign channel 3 a new task, dammit.

PRIORITY: Output Spooling, GD/PD, Loading, Input Spooling.

Channel3 
 public Channel3(Drisk d,
                 Memory m,
                 MOS z,
                 CPU c,
                 BufferPool b,
                 Queue q,
                 Queue t)
Constructor.

Parameters:
d - reference to the drisk
m - ref to memory
z - ref to mos
c - ref to cpu
b - ref to buffy (the vampire slayer) pool
q - ref to the ReadyQ
t - ref to the TerminateQ (DIE! Die you BASTARDS!)

Loading. Loads the program cards into memory. one. at. a. time.

Simulates the GD and PD instructions.

Returns:
true if channel3 is busy, false otherwise

addToLoadQ 
 public void addToLoadQ(PCB p)
Add the PCB to the Load queue, for loading...

Parameters:
p - The PCB to enqueue
getTaskFlag 
 public int getTaskFlag()
What the $%@& is Channel3 doing?

  • 0 nothing
  • 1 output spooling
  • 2 GD or PD
  • 3 loading
  • 4 input spooling

    Returns:
    The task flag
    • setBusy 
     public void setBusy()
    Assign channel 3 a new task, dammit.

    PRIORITY: Output Spooling, GD/PD, Loading, Input Spooling.

    inputSpooling 
     public void inputSpooling()
    Input Spooling Checks inputFullBuffer for data cards Creates a new PCB if $JOB is called Uses inSpoolPCB to build a PCB

    outputSpooling 
     public void outputSpooling()
    Handles the final termination of a process. Sends Message data to an outputFullBuffer to be printed says is supposed to be printed, and puts it in the bufferPool as an outputFullBufer.

    interruptRoutine 
     public void interruptRoutine()
    The interrupt routine. Cleans up after whatever just finished and then assigns a new task.
